title: Stories about Women
main_text:
I write for those women who do not speak, for those who do not have a voice because they were so terrified, because we are taught to respect fear more than ourselves. We've been taught that silence would save us, but it won't.Audre Lorde

Athenaise by Kate Chopin

Kew Gardens by Virginia Woolf

Prelude by Katherine Mansfield

The Dilettante by Edith Wharton

Pride and Prejudice by Jane Austen

Sense and Sensibility by Jane Austen

Northanger Abbey by Jane Austen

Emma by Jane Austen

Gone With the Wind by Margaret Mitchel

Little Women by Louisa May Alcott

Tess of the d'Urbervilles by Thomas Hardy

A Doll's House : a play by Henrik Ibsen

Complete Original Short Stories of Guy De Maupassant by Guy de Maupassant

Anna Karenina by Leo Tolstoy

Pygmalion by Bernard Shaw

Madame Bovary by Gustave Flaubert

Women in Love by D. H. Lawrence

A Room with a View by E. M. Forster
